item.description: A tool for comparing different super funds or contribution amounts.

item.title: How Consumers Budget
item.description: Expanding our understanding of budgeting beliefs and behaviours.

item.title: Tax Time 2019
item.description: Encouraging customers to reduce their high-interest debts at tax time.

item.description: The Alignment Problem: How Can Machines Learn Human Values Brian Christian ★★★★★ XYZ The Ride of a Lifetime: Lessons Learned from 15 Years as CEO of the Walt Disney Company Cal Newport ★★★★★ XYZ Straight Choices: The Psychology of Decision Making Ben Newell, David Shanks, David Lagnado ★★★★★ XYZ How to Avoid a Climate Disaster: The Solutions We Have and the Breakthroughs We Need Bill Gates ★★★★★ XYZ A Promised Land

item.title: About
item.description: Hello! This is a personal website I created to share a bit about myself, what I’ve been reading, and (very occasionally) thoughts others might be interested in. I currently work as a Senior Behavioural Scientist at ANZ (previously CommBank), where my aim is to take an evidence-based approach to improving the financial outcomes of our customers. I’m also in my final year of my PhD at UNSW Sydney, with my research centred around how uncertainty influences the way we make financial decisions.

item.title: Cool Stuff
item.description: This is the catch-all page for everything else on this site. Here you will find: My “Work” Reading List: Brief reviews of books I’ve read related to behavioural science, adjacent fields, and work more broadly. Blog Posts: For the rare times that there are thoughts I feel are worth sharing. Cat Central: A collection of my favourite photos of Chonkie and Bonkie - my two British Shorthair cats.

item.title: CV
item.description: Click here for a PDF copy of my most recently updated resume. Last updated: Mar 2023 Employment Senior Behavioural Scientist, ANZ Feb 2023 - Present Behavioural Scientist, Commonwealth Bank of Australia Nov 2018 - Feb 2023 Applied behavioural science with the purpose of improving the financial wellbeing of customers and communities. Examples of previous work: Leading a program of work aimed at leveraging behavioural science insights to improve the bank’s approach to scams and fraud.

item.title: Other Books
item.description: This page is a collection of the “non-work-related” books I’ve read (mostly fiction) that I didn’t think were worth including in the main lists. The list is organised by rating (highest to lowest). The same rating system applies :) ★★★★★ 5 stars ★★★★☆ 4 stars ★★★☆☆ 3 stars ★★☆☆☆ 2 stars ★☆☆☆☆ 1 star ★★★★★ 5 stars ★★★★☆ 4 stars ★★★☆☆ 3 stars ★★☆☆☆ 2 stars ★☆☆☆☆ 1 stars

item.title: Reading List
item.description: Page under development :) I enjoy reading books that are directly related to behavioural science, related to an adjacent field (e.g., design thinking, data science), or that share interesting ideas and perspectives. My goal in maintaining this list is to motivate myself to note my thoughts after each book, which I can always come back to reference in the future. 2023 Books Below, you’ll find the books I’m currently reading or have read this year.
